metadata.Title: CVE-2021-26260 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow leading to a heap-buffer overflow was found in theDwaCompressor of OpenEXR in versions before 3.0.1. An attacker could usethis flaw to crash an application compiled with OpenEXR. This is adifferent flaw from CVE-2021-23215.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-26260` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr22 - 2.2.0-10ubuntu2.6+esm1
openexr - 2.2.0-10ubuntu2.6+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openexr package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-10ubuntu2.6+esm1').
